snippet: FIFA announced that it would begin an ethics investigation of Valcke related to allegations of improper ticket sales. He was released from his duties “effective immediately."
abstract: FIFA secretary general Jerome Valcke, who was not named in indictment brought against organization by United States Justice Dept, is relieved of his duties after corruption allegations surface regarding World Cup ticket sales; will be investigated by FIFA Ethics Committee.

byline.original: By SAM BORDEN and REBECCA R. RUIZ

lead_paragraph: FIFA announced that it would begin an ethics investigation of Valcke related to allegations of improper ticket sales. He was released from his duties “effective immediately."

headline.main: Top FIFA Executive Jérôme Valcke Placed on Leave Amid Corruption Investigation
headline.print_headline: FIFA Puts Blatter’s Top Deputy on Leave Amid Corruption Investigation
